title: 111_hr3149
content: The "Equal Employment for All Act" prohibits the use of credit checks for employment purposes. The "Equal Employment for All Act" prohibits the use of credit checks for employment purposes, including for adverse actions. It amends the Fair Credit Reporting Act to restrict the use of consumer reports for employment decisions. The "Equal Employment for All Act" prohibits the use of consumer reports for employment decisions, even with consumer consent. Exceptions exist for specific situations where an employer may use a consumer report. Exceptions to the "Equal Employment for All Act" include situations where a consumer applies for or holds certain types of employment, such as positions requiring national security clearance, government agency roles, financial institution positions, or when mandated by law. These exceptions do not affect other disclosure and notification requirements of the Act. The Act includes requirements for disclosure and notification to consumers when using consumer reports for employment purposes or adverse actions. Amendments to sections 603 and 604 of the Act are made to ensure compliance with restrictions. Amendments are made to subsections (B), (C), and (D) in the Act to ensure compliance with restrictions set forth in subsection (b) and redesignated sections. Amendments are made to various sections of the Act to update references from subsection (c) to subsection (d) for compliance with restrictions. Amendments are made to update references in section 615 of the Act from subsection (c) to subsection (d) for compliance with restrictions. This includes changes such as replacing "section 604(c)(1)(B)" with "section 604(d)(1)(B)" and updating other subsection references accordingly.
